INS_HNTC2_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

INS_HNTC2_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

INS_HNTC2_FM_RAT.Description: The minimum ratio below the configured frequency to take throttle based notch filters when flying at a throttle level below the reference throttle. Note that lower frequency notch filters will have more phase lag. If you want throttle based notch filtering to be effective at a throttle up to 30% below the configured notch frequency then set this parameter to 0.7. The default of 1.0 means the notch will not go below the frequency in the FREQ parameter.

INS_HNTC2_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

INS_HNTC2_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of 0 disables this filter. The first harmonic refers to the base frequency.

INS_HNTC2_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based harmonic notch cannot be used on fixed wing only planes. It can for Copters, QuaadPlane(while in VTOL modes), and Rovers.
INS_HNTC2_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode

Bitmask.5: Use min freq on RPM source failure

INS_HNTC2_OPTS.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Triple and double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth with reduced latency than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Multi-Source attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz. If both double and triple notches are specified only double notches will take effect.

INS_HNTC2_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter.  For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed.  The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter.  This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required.  For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

INS_HNTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

INS_HNTCH_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

INS_HNTCH_FM_RAT.Description: The minimum ratio below the configured frequency to take throttle based notch filters when flying at a throttle level below the reference throttle. Note that lower frequency notch filters will have more phase lag. If you want throttle based notch filtering to be effective at a throttle up to 30% below the configured notch frequency then set this parameter to 0.7. The default of 1.0 means the notch will not go below the frequency in the FREQ parameter.

INS_HNTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

INS_HNTCH_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of 0 disables this filter. The first harmonic refers to the base frequency.

INS_HNTCH_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based harmonic notch cannot be used on fixed wing only planes. It can for Copters, QuaadPlane(while in VTOL modes), and Rovers.
INS_HNTCH_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode

Bitmask.5: Use min freq on RPM source failure

INS_HNTCH_OPTS.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Triple and double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth with reduced latency than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Multi-Source attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz. If both double and triple notches are specified only double notches will take effect.

INS_HNTCH_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter.  For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed.  The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter.  This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required.  For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

INS_LOG_BAT_CNT.Description: Number of samples to take when logging streams of IMU sensor readings.  Will be rounded down to a multiple of 32. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

INS_LOG_BAT_LGCT.Description: Number of samples to push to count every INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN

INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN.Description: Interval between pushing samples to the AP_Logger log

INS_LOG_BAT_MASK.Description: Bitmap of which IMUs to log batch data for. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

Bitmask.0: Sensor-Rate Logging (sample at full sensor rate seen by AP)

KDE_NPOLE.Description: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the block backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for block backend

LOG_DARM_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to any backend when disarmed. A value of zero means that the normal backend rate limit is applied.

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled at all times including when disarmed. Logging before arming can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues and is necessary if logging of EKF replay data is selected via the LOG_REPLAY parameter. If LOG_DISARMED is set to 2, then logging will be enabled when disarmed, but not if a USB connection is detected. This can be used to prevent unwanted data logs being generated when the vehicle is connected via USB for log downloading or parameter changes. If LOG_DISARMED is set to 3 then logging will happen while disarmed, but if the vehicle never arms then the logs using the filesystem backend will be discarded on the next boot.

Values.3: Discard log on reboot if never armed

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device.  Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging but increases memory usage.  This buffer size may be reduced to free up available memory
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Logging File and Block Backend buffer size max (in kilobytes)

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed.  If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm

LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.Description: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log
LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.DisplayName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space

LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the file backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for file backend

LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.Description: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.
LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout before giving up on file writes

LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.Description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink
LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size

LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for mavlink backend

LOG_MAX_FILES.Description: This sets the maximum number of log file that will be written on dataflash or sd card before starting to rotate log number. Limit is capped at 500 logs.

LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 and EKF3 state estimators will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. LOG_DISARMED must be set to 1 or 2 or else the log will not contain the pre-flight data required for replay testing of the EKF's. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost.
LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay

AEROM_ALT_ABORT.Description: Maximum allowable loss in altitude during a trick or sequence from its starting altitude.

AEROM_ANG_TC.Description: This is the time over which we filter the desired roll to smooth it

AEROM_DEBUG.Description: This controls the printing of extra debug information on paths

AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.Description: This controls how rapidly we roll into a new orientation
AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.DisplayName: The roll rate to use when entering a roll maneuver

AEROM_ERR_COR_D.Description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path
AEROM_ERR_COR_D.DisplayName: D gain for path error corrections

AEROM_ERR_COR_P.Description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path
AEROM_ERR_COR_P.DisplayName: P gain for path error corrections

AEROM_KE_RUDD.Description: Percent of rudder normally uses to sustain knife-edge at trick speed

AEROM_KE_RUDD_LK.Description: Time to look ahead in the path to calculate rudder correction for bank angle

AEROM_LKAHD.Description: This is how much time to look ahead in the path for calculating path rates

AEROM_MIS_ANGLE.Description: When set to a non-zero value, this is the assumed direction of the mission. Otherwise the waypoint angle is used

AEROM_PATH_SCALE.Description: Scale factor for Path/Box size. 0.5 would half the distances in maneuvers. Radii are unaffected.

AEROM_ROL_COR_TC.Description: This is the time constant for correcting roll errors. A smaller value leads to faster roll corrections

AEROM_SPD_I.Description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_SPD_P.Description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_STALL_PIT.Description: Pitch threashold for moving to final stage of stall turn

AEROM_STALL_THR.Description: Amount of throttle to reduce to for a stall turn

AEROM_THR_BOOST.Description: This is the extra throttle added in schedule elements marked as needing a throttle boost

AEROM_THR_LKAHD.Description: This controls how far ahead we look in time along the path for the target throttle

AEROM_THR_PIT_FF.Description: This controls how much extra throttle to add based on pitch ange. The value is for 90 degrees and is applied in proportion to pitch

AEROM_TIME_COR_P.Description: This is the time constant for correcting path position errors
AEROM_TIME_COR_P.DisplayName: Time constant for correction of our distance along the path

AEROM_TS_I.Description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_P.Description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_RATE.Description: This sets the rate we send data for time sync between aircraft
AEROM_TS_RATE.DisplayName: Timesync rate of send of NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT data

AEROM_TS_SPDMAX.Description: This sets the maximum speed adjustment for time sync between aircraft

AEROM_YAW_ACCEL.Description: This is maximum yaw acceleration to use

AHRS_ORIG_ALT.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this altitude (in meters above sea level) if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_LAT.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this latitude if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_LON.Description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this longitude if not already set

AUTOLAND_WP_ALT.Description: Altitude of final approach waypoint created by script

AUTOLAND_WP_DIST.Description: Distance from landng point (HOME) to final approach waypoint created by script in the opposite direction of initial takeoff

CGA_RATIO.Description: The ratio between the front and back motor outputs during steady-state hover. Positive when the CoG is in front of the motors midpoint (front motors work harder).

DIST_CUTOFF.Description: The distance from target beyond which the target is ignored

DR_ENABLE_DIST.Description: Distance from home (in meters) beyond which the dead reckoning will be enabled

DR_FLY_ALT_MIN.Description: Copter will fly at at least this altitude (in meters) above home during deadreckoning

DR_FLY_TIMEOUT.Description: Copter will attempt to switch to NEXT_MODE after this many seconds of deadreckoning.  If it cannot switch modes it will continue in Guided_NoGPS.  Set to 0 to disable timeout

DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.Description: GPS speed accuracy maximum, above which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 0.8).  Lower values trigger with good GPS quality, higher values will allow poorer GPS before triggering. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS speed accuracy
DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.DisplayName: Deadreckoning GPS speed accuracy maximum threshold

DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.Description: GPS satellite count threshold below which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 6).  Higher values trigger with good GPS quality, Lower values trigger with worse GPS quality. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS satellite count
DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.DisplayName: Deadreckoning GPS satellite count min threshold

DR_GPS_TRIGG_SEC.Description: GPS checks must fail for this many seconds before dead reckoning will be triggered

DR_NEXT_MODE.Description: Copter switch to this mode after GPS recovers or DR_FLY_TIMEOUT has elapsed.  Default is 6/RTL.  Set to -1 to return to mode used before deadreckoning was triggered

EFI_2K_CANDRV.Description: NMEA 2000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_DLA_LPS.Description: EFI DLA litres of fuel per second of injection time

EFI_H6K_CANDRV.Description: Halo6000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_H6K_FUELTOT.Description: The capacity of the tank in litres

EFI_H6K_START_FN.Description: The RC auxilliary function number for start/stop of the generator. Zero to disable start function

EFI_H6K_TELEM_RT.Description: The rate that additional generator telemetry is sent

EFI_INF_IGN_AUX.Description: EFI INF throttle ignition aux function

EFI_SP_GEN_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI generator control function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling generator start/stop

EFI_SP_LOG_RT.Description: SkyPower EFI log rate. This is the rate at which extra logging of the SkyPower EFI is performed

EFI_SP_MIN_RPM.Description: SkyPower EFI minimum RPM. This is the RPM below which the engine is considered to be stopped

EFI_SP_RST_TIME.Description: SkyPower EFI restart time. If engine should be running and it has stopped for this amount of time then auto-restart. To disable this feature set this value to zero.

EFI_SP_START_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI start function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling engine start

EFI_SP_ST_DISARM.Description: SkyPower EFI allow start disarmed. This controls if starting the engine while disarmed is allowed

EFI_SP_THR_FN.Description: SkyPower EFI throttle function. This sets which SERVOn_FUNCTION to use for the target throttle. This should be 70 for fixed wing aircraft and 31 for helicopter rotor speed control

EFI_SP_THR_RATE.Description: SkyPower EFI throttle rate. This sets rate at which throttle updates are sent to the engine

EFI_SP_TLM_RT.Description: SkyPower EFI telemetry rate. This is the rate at which extra telemetry values are sent to the GCS

EFI_SVF_ARMCHECK.Description: Check for Generator ARM state before arming

ESC_HW_OFS.Description: Motor number offset of first ESC

ESC_HW_POLES.Description: Number of motor poles for eRPM scaling

ESRC_EXTN_QUAL.Description: ExternalNav may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_EXTN_THRESH.Description: ExternalNav may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_QUAL.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_THRESH.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_RNGFND_MAX.Description: OpticalFlow may be used if rangefinder distance is below this threshold

FOLT_MAV_CHAN.Description: MAVLink channel to which FOLLOW_TARGET should be sent

PLND_ALT_CUTOFF.Description: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

POI_DIST_MAX.Description: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

PREV_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.Description: If while tuning the angle error goes over this limit then the tune will aborts to prevent a bad oscillation in the case of the tuning algorithm failing. If you get an error "Tuning: attitude error ABORTING" and you think it is a false positive then you can either raise this parameter or you can try increasing the QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME to do the tune more slowly. A value of zero disables this check.
QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: maximum angle error for tune abort

QUIK_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

QUIK_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME.Description: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN.Description: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

QUIK_MAX_REDUCE.Description: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

QUIK_OPTIONS.Description: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

QUIK_OSC_SMAX.Description: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

QUIK_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

QUIK_YAW_D_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw D gain

QUIK_YAW_P_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw P gain

QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

RCK_DEBUG.Description: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

RCK_ENABLE.Description: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

RCK_FORCEHL.Description: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

RCK_PERIOD.Description: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

RCK_TIMEOUT.Description: If RCK_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled
RCK_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages

RTUN_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

RTUN_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

RTUN_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio

RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio

RTUN_SPEED_MIN.Description: The mimimum speed in m/s required for tuning to start
RTUN_SPEED_MIN.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune minimum speed for tuning

RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain
RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio

RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio

RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio

SHIP_AUTO_OFS.Description: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

SHIP_LAND_ANGLE.Description: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

SLUP_DEBUG.Description: Slung payload debug output, set to 1 to enable debug

SLUP_DIST_MAX.Description: Oscillation is suppressed when vehicle and payload are no more than this distance horizontally.  Set to 0 to always suppress

SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.Description: payload's position estimator's time constant used to compensate for GPS errors and wind.  Higher values result in smoother estimate but slower response
SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.DisplayName: Slung Payload resting offset estimate filter time constant

SLUP_SYSID.Description: Slung Payload mavlink system id.  0 to use any/all system ids

SLUP_VEL_P.Description: Slung Payload Velocity P gain, higher values will result in faster movements in sync with payload

SLUP_WP_POS_P.Description: WP position P gain. higher values will result in vehicle moving more quickly back to the original waypoint
SLUP_WP_POS_P.DisplayName: Slung Payload return to WP position P gain

TERR_BRK_ALT.Description: terrain brake altitude. The altitude above the ground below which BRAKE mode will be engaged if in LOITER mode.

TERR_BRK_HDIST.Description: terrain brake home distance. The distance from home where the auto BRAKE will be enabled. When within this distance of home the script will not activate

TERR_BRK_SPD.Description: terrain brake speed threshold. Don't trigger BRAKE if both horizontal speed and descent rate are below this threshold. By setting this to a small value this can be used to allow the user to climb up to a safe altitude in LOITER mode. A value of 0.5 is recommended if you want to use LOITER to recover from an emergency terrain BRAKE mode change.

TOFSENSE_ID1.Description: First TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. Leave this at 0 to accept all IDs and if only one sensor is present. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_ID2.Description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_ID3.Description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_INST1.Description: First TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 1 will pick the first backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_INST2.Description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 2 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_INST3.Description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 3 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_MODE.Description: TOFSENSE-M mode to be used. 0 for 8x8 mode. 1 for 4x4 mode

TOFSENSE_NO.Description: Number of TOFSENSE-M CAN sensors connected

TOFSENSE_PRX.Description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)
TOFSENSE_PRX.DisplayName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor

TOFSENSE_S1_BR.Description: Serial Port baud rate. Sensor baud rate can be changed from Nassistant software

TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.Description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)
TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.DisplayName: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor

TOFSENSE_S1_SP.Description: UART instance sensor is connected to. Set 1 if sensor is connected to the port with fist SERIALx_PROTOCOL = 28.

TRIK_ACT_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick action (abort,announce,execute)

TRIK_COUNT.Description: Number of tricks which can be selected over the range of the trik selection RC channel

TRIK_ENABLE.Description: Enables Tricks on Switch. TRIK params hidden until enabled

TRIK_SEL_FN.Description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick selection

VID1_IPADDR0.Description: Video stream IP Address first octet

VID1_IPADDR1.Description: Video stream IP Address second octet

VID1_IPADDR2.Description: Video stream IP Address third octet

VID1_IPADDR3.Description: Video stream IP Address fourth octet

VID1_IPPORT.DisplayName: Camera1 Video Stream IP Address Port

VIEP_CAM_SWHIGH.Description: Camera selection when switch is in high position

VIEP_CAM_SWLOW.Description: Camera selection when switch is in low position

VIEP_CAM_SWMID.Description: Camera selection when switch is in middle position

VIEP_ZOOM_SPEED.Description: ViewPro Zoom Speed.  Higher numbers result in faster zooming

WEB_BLOCK_SIZE.Description: web server block size for download

WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.Description: sendfile is an offloading mechanism for faster file download. If this is non-zero and the file is larger than this size then sendfile will be used for file download
WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.DisplayName: web server minimum file size for sendfile

WINCH_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control winch rate

MAV_GCS_SYSID.Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

MAV_OPTIONS.Description: Alters various behaviour of the MAVLink interface

MAV_SYSID.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network
MAV_SYSID.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

MAV_TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

NET_P1_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NET_P2_TYPE.Description: Port type for network serial port. For the two client types a valid destination IP address must be set. For the two server types either 0.0.0.0 or a local address can be used. The UDP client type will use broadcast if the IP is set to 255.255.255.255 and will use UDP multicast if the IP is in the multicast address range.

NET_PASS1_BAUD1.Description: The baud rate used for Endpoint 1. Only applies to serial ports.

NET_PASS1_BAUD2.Description: The baud rate used for Endpoint 2. Only applies to serial ports.

NET_PASS1_ENABLE.Description: Enable Passthrough of any UART, Network, or CAN ports to any UART, Network, or CAN ports.

NET_PASS1_EP1.Description: Passthrough Endpoint 1. This can be a serial port UART, a Network port, or a CAN port. The selected port will route to Endport 2.

NET_PASS1_EP2.Description: Passthrough Endpoint 2. This can be a serial port UART, a Network port, or a CAN port. The selected port will route to Endport 1.

NET_PASS1_OPT1.Description: Control over UART options for Endpoint 1. Only applies to serial ports.

NET_PASS1_OPT2.Description: Control over UART options for Endpoint 2. Only applies to serial ports.

NET_PASS4_EP1.Description: Passthrough Endpoint 1. This can be a serial port UART, a Network port, or a CAN port. The selected port will route to Endport 2.

NET_PASS4_EP2.Description: Passthrough Endpoint 2. This can be a serial port UART, a Network port, or a CAN port. The selected port will route to Endport 1.

NET_PASS4_OPT1.Description: Control over UART options for Endpoint 1. Only applies to serial ports.

NET_PASS4_OPT2.Description: Control over UART options for Endpoint 2. Only applies to serial ports.

NMEA_MSG_EN.Description: This is a bitmask of enabled NMEA messages. All messages will be sent consecutively at the same rate interval

NMEA_RATE_MS.Description: NMEA Output rate. This controls the interval at which all the enabled NMEA messages are sent. Most NMEA systems expect 100ms (10Hz) or slower.

NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL.Description: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

NTF_BUZZ_PIN.Description: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET! Some the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

NTF_BUZZ_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME.Description: Control the volume of the buzzer

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_LEN.Description: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED.  OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.
NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.DisplayName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed

NTF_LED_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled

NTF_OREO_THEME.Description: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

Node_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

Node_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics, other set values will be ignored)

OUT_32_ENABLE.Description: This allows for up to 32 outputs, enabling parameters for outputs above 16

OUT_DSHOT_ESC.Description: DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available and the bit widths used. None means that no dshot commands will be executed. Some ESC types support Extended DShot Telemetry (EDT) which allows telemetry other than RPM data to be returned when using bi-directional dshot. If you enable EDT you must install EDT capable firmware for correct operation.

OUT_DSHOT_RATE.Description: DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

OUT_GPIO_MASK.Description: Bitmask of outputs which will be available as GPIOs. Any output with either the function set to -1 or with the corresponding bit set in this mask will be available for use as a GPIO pin

OUT_RATE.Description: Default output rate in Hz for all PWM outputs.

OUT_RC_FS_MSK.Description: Bitmask of scaled passthru output channels which will be set to their trim value during rc failsafe instead of holding their last position before failsafe.

OUT10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

OUT10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

OUT10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

OUT_BLH_3DMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction. Note that setting an ESC as reversible with this option on AM32 will result in the forward direction of the ESC changing. You can combine with parameter with the SERVO_BLH_RVMASK parameter to maintain the same direction when the ESC is in 3D mode as it has in unidirectional (non-3D) mode.

OUT_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors
OUT_BLH_AUTO.DisplayName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors

OUT_BLH_BDMASK.Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot telemetry. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
OUT_BLH_BDMASK.DisplayName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels

OUT_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

OUT_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

OUT_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

OUT_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

OUT_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

OUT_BLH_RVMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs to reverse motor direction. Note that when combined with SERVO_BLH_3DMASK this will change what direction is considered to be forward.

OUT_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

OUT_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

OUT_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

OUT_FTW_MASK.Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

OUT_FTW_RVMASK.Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

OUT_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

OUT_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

OUT_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

OUT_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

OUT_VOLZ_RANGE.Description: Range to map between 1000 and 2000 PWM. Default value of 200 gives full +-100 deg range of extended position command. This results in 0.2 deg movement per US change in PWM. If the full range is not needed it can be reduced to increase resolution. 40 deg range gives 0.04 deg movement per US change in PWM, this is higher resolution than possible with the VOLZ protocol so further reduction in range will not improve resolution. Reduced range does allow PWMs outside the 1000 to 2000 range, with 40 deg range 750 PWM results in a angle of -30 deg, 2250 would be +30 deg. This is still limited by the 200 deg maximum range of the actuator.

PRX_FILT.Description: Cutoff frequency for low pass filter applied to each face in the proximity boundary

PRX_LOG_RAW.Description: Set this parameter to one if logging unfiltered(raw) distances from sensor should be enabled

PRX1_ADDR.Description: The bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

PRX1_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

PRX2_ADDR.Description: The bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

PRX2_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX2_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX2_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX2_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

PRX4_ADDR.Description: The bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RC1_PORT.Description: This is the serial port number where SERIALx_PROTOCOL will be set to RC input.

RC1_PORT_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

RC_MSGRATE.Description: Rate at which RC input is sent via DroneCAN

RC_PROTOCOLS.Description: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

RELAY10_DEFAULT.Description: Should the relay default to on or off, this only applies to RELAYx_FUNC "Relay" (1). All other uses will pick the appropriate default output state from within the controlling function's parameters. Note that if INVERTED is set then the default is inverted.

RELAY10_FUNCTION.Description: The function the relay channel is mapped to.

RELAY10_INVERTED.Description: Should the relay output signal be inverted. If enabled, relay on would be pin low and relay off would be pin high. NOTE: this impact's DEFAULT.

RELAY10_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for relay control. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND1_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND1_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND1_GNDCLR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND1_GNDCLR.DisplayName: Distance from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND1_MAX.Description: Maximum distance in metres that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_MIN.Description: Minimum distance in metres that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND1_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Analog RSSI or Airspeed ports can be used for Analog inputs (some autopilots provide others also), Non-IOMCU Servo/MotorOutputs can be used for PWM input when configured as "GPIOs". Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins" for analog pin or "GPIOs", if PWM input type, to determine pin number.

RNGFND1_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND1_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND1_SNR_MIN.Description: RangeFinder Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND1_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND1_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND2_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND2_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND2_GNDCLR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

RNGFND3_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND4_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND4_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND4_GNDCLR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND4_GNDCLR.DisplayName: Distance from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND4_MAX.Description: Maximum distance in metres that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND4_MIN.Description: Minimum distance in metres that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND4_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND4_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Analog RSSI or Airspeed ports can be used for Analog inputs (some autopilots provide others also), Non-IOMCU Servo/MotorOutputs can be used for PWM input when configured as "GPIOs". Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins" for analog pin or "GPIOs", if PWM input type, to determine pin number.

RNGFND4_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND4_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND4_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND4_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND4_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND4_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND4_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND4_SNR_MIN.Description: RangeFinder Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND4_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND4_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND4_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND4_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND4_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND4_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RPM1_MAX.Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

Bitmask.0: No Scripts to run message if all scripts have stopped
Bitmask.1: Runtime messages for memory usage and execution time
Bitmask.3: log runtime memory usage and execution time
Bitmask.5: Save CRC of current scripts to loaded and running checksum parameters enabling pre-arm
Bitmask.6: Disable heap expansion on allocation failure

SCR_DIR_DISABLE.Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_LD_CHECKSUM.Description: Required XOR of CRC32 checksum of loaded scripts, vehicle will not arm with incorrect scripts loaded, -1 disables

SCR_RUN_CHECKSUM.Description: Required XOR of CRC32 checksum of running scripts, vehicle will not arm with incorrect scripts running, -1 disables

SCR_SDEV1_PROTO.DisplayName: Serial protocol of scripting serial device

SCR_SDEV2_PROTO.Description: Serial protocol of scripting serial device
SCR_SDEV2_PROTO.DisplayName: Serial protocol of scripting serial device

SCR_SDEV3_PROTO.Description: Serial protocol of scripting serial device
SCR_SDEV3_PROTO.DisplayName: Serial protocol of scripting serial device

SCR_THD_PRIORITY.Description: This sets the priority of the scripting thread. This is normally set to a low priority to prevent scripts from interfering with other parts of the system. Advanced users can change this priority if scripting needs to be prioritised for realtime applications. WARNING: changing this parameter can impact the stability of your flight controller. The scipting thread priority in this parameter is chosen based on a set of system level priorities for other subsystems. It is strongly recommended that you use the lowest priority that is sufficient for your application. Note that all scripts run at the same priority, so if you raise this priority you must carefully audit all lua scripts for behaviour that does not interfere with the operation of the system.

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SIM_BAR3_WCF_UP.Description: Barometer wind coefficient direction up in SITL

SIM_BARO_DRIFT.Description: Barometer altitude drifts at this rate

SIM_BARO_FREEZE.Description: Freeze barometer to last recorded altitude

SIM_BZ_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the simulated buzzer

SIM_BZ_PIN.Description: The pin number that the Buzzer is connected to (start at 1)

SIM_FTOWESC_ENA.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the FETtecOneWireESC simulator

SIM_FTOWESC_POW.Description: Allows you to turn power off to the simulated ESCs.  Bits correspond to the ESC ID, *NOT* their servo channel.

SIM_GPS1_LCKTIME.Description: Delay in seconds before GPS acquires lock

SIM_GPS1_NOISE.Description: Amplitude of the GPS altitude error

SIM_GPS1_NUMSATS.Description: Number of satellites GPS has in view

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_IE24_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the FuelCell simulator

SIM_IE24_ERROR.Description: Explicitly specify an error code to send to the generator

SIM_IE24_STATE.Description: Explicitly specify a state for the generator to be in

SIM_PARA_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Parachute simulation

SIM_PARA_PIN.Description: The pin number that the Parachute pyrotechnics are connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device center's height above SITL origin. Assumes a 2x2m square as station base
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device center's height SITL origin

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_SHIP.Description: This makes the position of the landing beacon follow the simulated ship from SIM_SHIP. The ship movement is controlled with the SIM_SHIP parameters

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north

Bitmask.1: Swap first 4 and last 4 servos (for quadplane testing)
Bitmask.2: Demix heli servos and send roll/pitch/collective/yaw

SIM_RICH_CTRL.Description: The pin number that the RichenPower spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_RICH_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the RichenPower simulator

SIM_SB_ARM_LEN.Description: distance from center of mass to one motor

SIM_SB_COL.Description: center of lift position above CoG

SIM_SB_FLR.Description: amount of additional lift generated by the helper balloon (for the purpose of ascent), as a proportion of the 'neutral buoyancy' lift

SIM_SB_MASS.Description: mass of blimp not including lifting gas

SIM_SB_MOT_THST.Description: thrust at max throttle for one motor

SIM_SB_YAW_RT.Description: maximum yaw rate with full left throttle at target altitude

SIM_SERVO_SPEED.Description: servo speed (time for 60 degree deflection). If DELAY and FILTER are not set then this is converted to a 1p lowpass filter. If DELAY or FILTER are set then this is treated as a rate of change limit

SIM_SHIP_OFS_X.Description: Defines the offset of the ship's landing pad w.r.t. the ship's origin, i.e. where the beacon is placed on the ship (X-axis)

SIM_SHIP_OFS_Y.Description: Defines the offset of the ship's landing pad w.r.t. the ship's origin, i.e. where the beacon is placed on the ship (Y-axis)

SIM_SHIP_OFS_Z.Description: Defines the offset of the ship's landing pad w.r.t. the ship's origin, i.e. where the beacon is placed on the ship (Z-axis)

SIM_SHIP_PSIZE.Description: Diameter of the circle the ship is traveling on

SIM_SLUP_DRAG.Description: Slung Payload drag coefficient.  Higher values increase drag and slow the payload more quickly

SIM_SLUP_LINELEN.Description: Slung Payload line length in meters

SIM_SLUP_SYSID.Description: Slung Payload MAVLink system id to distinguish it from others on the same network

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_TA_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the simulated tonealarm

SIM_TETH_DENSITY.Description: Linear mass density of the tether wire

SIM_TETH_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable the tether simulation

SIM_TETH_LINELEN.Description: Maximum length of the tether line in meters

SIM_TETH_SPGCNST.Description: Spring constant for the tether to simulate elastic forces when stretched beyond its maximum length

SIM_TETH_STUCK.Description: Enable or disable a stuck tether simulation

SIM_TETH_SYSID.Description: MAVLink system ID for the tether simulation, used to distinguish it from other systems on the network

SIM_VICON_POS_X.Description: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Forward direction
SIM_VICON_POS_X.DisplayName: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Forward direction

SIM_VICON_POS_Y.Description: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Right direction
SIM_VICON_POS_Y.DisplayName: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Right direction

SIM_VICON_POS_Z.Description: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Down direction
SIM_VICON_POS_Z.DisplayName: SITL vicon position on vehicle in Down direction

SIM_VICON_P_SD.Description: SITL vicon position standard deviation for gaussian noise
SIM_VICON_P_SD.DisplayName: SITL vicon position standard deviation for gaussian noise

SIM_VICON_V_SD.Description: SITL vicon velocity standard deviation for gaussian noise
SIM_VICON_V_SD.DisplayName: SITL vicon velocity standard deviation for gaussian noise

SIM_VICON_YAW.Description: SITL vicon yaw angle in earth frame
SIM_VICON_YAW.DisplayName: SITL vicon yaw angle in earth frame

SIM_VICON_YAWERR.Description: SITL vicon yaw added to reported yaw sent to vehicle

SIM_VOLZ_ENA.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Volz simulator

SIM_VOLZ_FMASK.Description: fail servo at current position.  Channel 1 is bit 0.

SIM_VOLZ_MASK.Description: mask of servo output channels to override with values from Volz protocol.  Note these are indexed from 0 - so channel 3 (usually throttle) has value 4 in this bitmask (1<<2).

Values.2: Log only instances with sensor source set to None

TEMP1_A0.Description: a0 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_A1.Description: a1 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_A2.Description: a2 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_A3.Description: a3 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_A4.Description: a4 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_A5.Description: a5 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP1_ADDR.Description: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

TEMP1_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP1_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for temprature monitoring. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".
TEMP1_PIN.DisplayName: Temperature sensor analog voltage sensing pin

TEMP1_SRC.Description: Sensor Source is used to designate which device's temperature report will be replaced by this temperature sensor's data. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log. In the future a new Motor temperature report will be created for returning data directly.

TEMP1_SRC_ID.Description: Sensor Source Identification is used to replace a specific instance of a system component's temperature report with the temp sensor's. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_ID = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_ID = 2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId/SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_ID=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

TEMP7_SRC_ID.Description: Sensor Source Identification is used to replace a specific instance of a system component's temperature report with the temp sensor's. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_ID = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_ID = 2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId/SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_ID=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

TEMP8_A0.Description: a0 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_A1.Description: a1 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_A2.Description: a2 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_A3.Description: a3 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_A4.Description: a4 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_A5.Description: a5 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4 + a5*voltage^5

TEMP8_ADDR.Description: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

TEMP8_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP8_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for temprature monitoring. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

UART0_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

UART0_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control. You must have the RTS and CTS pins available on the port. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.
